title: Composting in the city easier than ever with Baltimore Compost Collective
body: In case you didn't know, it's National Compost Awareness Week, and in south Baltimore, there's a youth-led organization making it easier than ever for residents to get rid of their food scraps. While goats take care of the vegetation at the Filbert Street Garden, Marvin Hayes sifts through soil enhancer -- the end result of composting, which takes about four months to create."Composting is the process of decomposing of your have your organic material -- like your coffee grinds, food scraps, vegetable scraps, garden trimmings -- and it turns it into this beautiful black humus, which I love to call black gold. You know that it's ready when you squeeze it and it sticks together," said Hayes, program director of the Baltimore Compost
